title: Bruschetta
steps: Slice the baguette into 1/2-inch thick slices.
Toast the slices on a grill or in a toaster oven until golden brown.
Finely chop the tomatoes and basil leaves.
In a bowl, mix the chopped tomatoes and basil with olive oil.
Rub each toasted baguette slice with a peeled garlic clove.
Top the baguette slices with the tomato mixture.
Serve immediately.

title: Grilled Chicken
steps: Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper on both sides.
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Brush the chicken breasts with olive oil.
Grill the chicken for 6-7 minutes on each side or until fully cooked.
Serve with lemon wedges.

title: Chocolate Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a large bowl, mix flour, cocoa powder, sugar, and baking powder.
Add eggs and melted butter to the dry ingredients and mix well.
Gradually add milk to the batter, stirring continuously until smooth.
Pour the batter into a greased 9x13-inch baking pan.
Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Allow the cake to cool before serving.

title: Lemonade
steps: Juice the lemons to make 1 cup of lemon juice.
In a pitcher, combine lemon juice and sugar.
Stir until the sugar is completely dissolved.
Add water to the pitcher and mix well.
Add ice cubes to serve chilled.

title: Stuffed Mushrooms
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Clean the mushrooms and remove the stems.
In a bowl, mix cream cheese, Parmesan cheese, garlic, parsley, salt, and pepper.
Stuff each mushroom cap with the cheese mixture.
Place the stuffed mushrooms on a baking sheet.
Bake for 20 minutes or until the tops are golden brown.
Serve warm.

title: Beef Stroganoff
steps: Season the beef with salt and pepper, then toss with flour.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium-high heat.
Add the beef and cook until browned. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, sauté onions and garlic until translucent.
Add mushrooms and cook until softened.
Pour in beef broth and Worcestershire sauce, bringing to a simmer.
Return the beef to the skillet and cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in sour cream and heat through without boiling.
Serve over cooked egg noodles.

title: Apple Pie
steps: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
Place one pie crust in a 9-inch pie dish.
In a large bowl, combine apples, sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, and lemon juice.
Pour the apple mixture into the pie crust.
Dot the filling with small pieces of butter.
Cover with the second pie crust and seal the edges.
Cut small slits in the top crust to allow steam to escape.
Bake for 45-50 minutes or until the crust is golden brown.
Let the pie cool before serving.

title: Iced Tea
steps: Steep the tea bags in boiling water for 5 minutes.
Remove the tea bags and stir in sugar until dissolved.
Let the tea mixture cool to room temperature.
Pour the tea into a pitcher and add cold water.
Refrigerate until chilled.
Serve over ice cubes and garnish with lemon slices.

title: Caprese Salad
steps: Slice the tomatoes and mozzarella cheese into 1/4-inch thick slices.
Arrange the tomato and mozzarella slices alternately on a platter.
Tuck fresh basil leaves between the slices.
Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately.

title: Spaghetti Bolognese
steps: In a large skillet, cook ground beef over medium heat until browned. Drain excess fat.
Add chopped onion and minced garlic to the beef and cook until the onion is translucent.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, and basil.
Season with salt and pepper. Simmer the sauce for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Meanwhile, cook spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente. Drain.
Serve the Bolognese sauce over the spaghetti and top with grated Parmesan cheese.

title: Cheesecake
steps: Preheat the oven to 325°F (163°C).
In a bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs and melted butter. Press the mixture into the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan.
In a large mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth and creamy.
Add sour cream and vanilla extract, mixing until well combined.
Add eggs one at a time, beating just until combined after each addition.
Pour the cream cheese mixture over the crust in the springform pan.
Bake for 50-60 minutes, or until the center is set.
Turn off the oven and let the cheesecake cool in the oven with the door slightly open for 1 hour.
Refrigerate the cheesecake for at least 4 hours before serving.

title: Mojito
steps: Place mint leaves and 1 lime wedge into a sturdy glass.
Use a muddler to crush the mint and lime to release the mint oils and lime juice.
Add 2 more lime wedges and the sugar, and muddle again to release the lime juice.
Do not strain the mixture.
Fill the glass almost to the top with ice cubes.
Pour the rum over the ice, and fill the glass with soda water.
Stir well and garnish with the remaining lime wedge.
